name: PixelFem #10 - Women’s Liberation Movement
description:
The Women’s Liberation Movement (WLM) famously disrupted the 1970 Miss World beauty pageant in London, in revolt against its objectification of women. Their eye-catching protest - which included flour bombs - would raise the profile of the budding feminist movement, its strident message echoing down the years and inspiring generations of women. Relieving the moment, one of the protesters, Sue Finch says “I began to throw flour bombs and leaflets over the balcony. And suddenly, all around me were other women doing the same. It was as if snow was falling … it was a wonderful moment …”. 

✺This work is part of PixelFems, an evolving project on the Tezos blockchain celebrating iconic women from the past and present✺
